sn12.40:4.2: “Mendicants, what you intend or plan, and what you have tendencies for become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.40:4.3: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.40:4.4: When consciousness is established and grows, there is an inclination.
sn12.40:4.5: When there is an inclination, there is coming and going.
sn12.40:4.6: When there is coming and coming, there is passing away and reappearing.
sn12.40:4.7: When there is passing away and reappearing, future birth, old age, and death come to be, as do sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.40:4.8: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.40:5.1: If you don’t intend or plan, but still have tendencies, this becomes a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.40:5.2: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.40:5.3: When consciousness is established and grows, there is an inclination.
sn12.40:5.4: When there is an inclination, there is coming and going.
sn12.40:5.5: When there is coming and coming, there is passing away and reappearing.
sn12.40:5.6: When there is passing away and reappearing, future birth, old age, and death come to be, as do sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.40:5.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.40:6.1: If you don’t intend or plan or have tendencies, this doesn’t become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.40:6.2: With no support, consciousness is not established.
sn12.40:6.3: When consciousness is not established and doesn’t grow, there’s no inclination.
sn12.40:6.4: When there’s no inclination, there’s no coming and going.
sn12.40:6.5: When there’s no coming and coming, there’s no passing away and reappearing.
sn12.40:6.6: When there’s no passing away and reappearing, future birth, old age, and death cease, as do sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.40:6.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
